intro: Henningia saprjagajevii, commonly known as the Khabarovsk heath, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. Native to the Russian Far East, it thrives in acidic, well-drained soils typical of mountainous regions. The plant produces white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its horticultural value lies in its ornamental appeal and adaptability to cool, humid climates.
